intro: Oteiza acuminata, commonly known as the slender thornapple, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains toxic compounds, which can be harmful to livestock and humans. It typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Oteiza acuminata is often found in coastal and inland regions, adapting well to a variety of environmental conditions.
